overview: Satish has over 25 years of private equity, corporate finance and business strategy experience. He was earlier a Director of CDC Advisors (now Actis) where he was involved in many important investments and exits, such as the CDC-led privatisation of Punjab Tractor, which won the Acquisitions Monthly Emerging Market Deal of the Year Award for 2003. As CFO and Head of Business Strategy at JK Paper, he restructured a USD 210 million balance sheet and raised USD 177 million of funds from various sources, including private equity from Goldman Sachs and IFC. As head of Investment Banking at SRF Finance (a part of GE Capital since 1997 ) he set up the Structured Finance, Corporate Broking, Investment Banking and Private Equity practice of the company and led the company in the areas of securitisation, advisory, investments, underwriting and issue management. Prior to joining the financial sector he worked with SRF and Eicher, where he was responsible for assessing and creating new businesses. He is a member of the Planning Commissionâ€™s Working Group on Power & the CII Committee on Economic Affairs and Taxation. Satish received an MBA from the Faculty of Management Studies, Delhi University, and a BE in Industrial Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT), Roorkee. Satish is married and has 2 grown up daughters. He likes reading about and evolving creative options.
